hello: Hello World. This is me testing
home:about1: Aṇu (pronounced /ɐɳʊ/) translates to an atom in Sanskrit.
home:about2: Aṇu is a collection of UI components that enable you to build extraordinary applications.
home:mainHeading: Component library for React Native and React Native Web
home:subHeading: Based on the Material design, support for more design systems coming soon.
footer:image-caption: Component library for React Native and React Native Web
badgeDocumentation:mainDescription: Badges are used to display a small amount of information, typically a number or a short status message, on top of an icon or avatar.
badgeDocumentation:example1-description: Notification badges are used to provide a visual indicator of new or updated information.
badgeDocumentation:example2-description: Status badges are used to provide a visual indicator of status of a component or information.
badgeDocumentation:property-showZero-des: whether the badge should be displayed when value is zero.
badgeDocumentation:property-maxValue-des: Beyond this, the content will be shown as + appended to max value.
badgeDocumentation:property-overlap-desc: The shape of the overlaying container of the badge.
badgeDocumentation:property-contentStyle: The styles for the badge content.
badgeDocumentation:property-sx-descripti: The extended styles for the badge.
regularButtonDocumentation:mainDescripti: Buttons help users navigate, interact, and engage with websites and apps.
regularButtonDocumentation:heading: Common Buttons
regularButtonDocumentation:subTitle: Buttons help people initiate actions, from sending an email, to sharing a document, to liking a post.There are five types of regular buttons: elevated, filled, filled tonal, outlined, and text.
regularButtonDocumentation:property-titl: The label/title for the regular button.
regularButtonDocumentation:property-type: The type of the regular button.
regularButtonDocumentation:property-icon: The icon component or the icon props for material icons.
regularButtonDocumentation:property-cont: The styles for the regular button component.
regularButtonDocumentation:property-labe: The styles for the label of the button.
regularButtonDocumentation:property-pres: The properties of the pressable component of react native (except sx).
FABDocumentation:mainDescription: Buttons help users navigate, interact, and engage with websites and apps.
FABDocumentation:heading: Floating Action Buttons
FABDocumentation:subTitle: The FAB represents the most important action on a screen. It puts key actions within reach. There are three sizes of floating action buttons: FAB, small FAB, and large FAB.
FABDocumentation:property-size-descripti: The size of the floating action button
FABDocumentation:property-icon-descripti: The icon component or the icon props for material icons.
FABDocumentation:property-FABColor-descr: The theme color of the FAB.
FABDocumentation:property-lowered-descri: Whether the FAB is lowered than usual FAB elevation.
FABDocumentation:property-containerStyle: The styles for the regular button component.
FABDocumentation:property-pressableProps: The properties of the pressable component of react native (except sx)
extendedFABDocumentation:mainDescription: Buttons help users navigate, interact, and engage with websites and apps.
extendedFABDocumentation:heading: Extended Floating Action Buttons
extendedFABDocumentation:subTitle: Extended FABs help people take primary actions. They are wider than FABs to accommodate a text label and larger target area.
extendedFABDocumentation:property-title-: The label/title for the regular button
extendedFABDocumentation:property-icon-d: The icon component or the icon props for material icons.
extendedFABDocumentation:property-FABCol: The theme color of the FAB.
extendedFABDocumentation:property-lowere: Whether the FAB is lowered than usual FAB elevation.
extendedFABDocumentation:property-contai: The styles for the regular button component.
extendedFABDocumentation:property-titleS: The styles for the label of the button.
extendedFABDocumentation:property-pressa: The properties of the pressable component of react native (except sx)
iconButtonDocumentation:mainDescription: Buttons help users navigate, interact, and engage with websites and apps.
iconButtonDocumentation:heading: Icon Buttons
iconButtonDocumentation:subTitle:
Icon buttons help people take supplementary actions with a single tap. There are four types of icon buttons: filled, filled tonal, outlined, and standard.

We support Material Icons from react native vector icons package, you can refer the icon names from their site
iconButtonDocumentation:property-type-de: The type of the icon button
iconButtonDocumentation:property-icon-de: The icon component or the icon props for material icons.
iconButtonDocumentation:property-toggle-: Whether the icon button is toggle-able.
iconButtonDocumentation:property-selecte: Whether the toggle-able icon button is selected or not.
iconButtonDocumentation:property-contain: The styles for the icon button component.
iconButtonDocumentation:property-pressab: The properties of the pressable component of react native (except sx)
segmentedButtonDocumentation:mainDescrip: Buttons help users navigate, interact, and engage with websites and apps.
segmentedButtonDocumentation:heading: Segmented Buttons
segmentedButtonDocumentation:subTitle: Segmented buttons help people select options, switch views, or sort elements. There are two types of segmented buttons: single-select and multi-select.
segmentedButtonDocumentation:property-ti: The label/title for the regular button
segmentedButtonDocumentation:property-se: The ids of selected members of the segmented button group
segmentedButtonDocumentation:property-ic: The icon component or the icon props for material icons.
segmentedButtonDocumentation:property-on: The callback when there is a press or click on the segmented button.
segmentedButtonDocumentation:property-mu: whether the multiple segmented buttons can be selected at once
segmentedButtonDocumentation:property-on: The callback when there is a press or click on the segmented buttons.
segmentedButtonDocumentation:property-co: The style for the segmented button group container.
segmentedButtonDocumentation:property-st: The styles for the segmented button component.
segmentedButtonDocumentation:property-ti: The styles for the label of the button.
checkBoxDocumentation:mainDescription: Checkboxes allow users to select one or more items from a set. They can turn an option on or off.
checkBoxDocumentation:property-indetermi: If true, the component appears indeterminate.
checkBoxDocumentation:property-label-des: The label to display with the checkbox.
checkBoxDocumentation:property-labelPlac: Position where the label should be placed.
checkBoxDocumentation:property-disabled-: If true, the component is disabled.
checkBoxDocumentation:property-error-des: Whether an error occurred regarding to the checkbox.
checkBoxDocumentation:property-iconSize-: The size of the checked icon.
checkBoxDocumentation:property-color-des: The color of the checkbox component.
checkBoxDocumentation:property-style-des: The styles for the checkbox component.
checkBoxDocumentation:property-iconStyle: The styles for the checked Icon.
checkBoxDocumentation:property-labelStyl: The styles for the label of the checkbox.
checkBoxDocumentation:property-container: The styles for the container of the checkbox.
checkBoxDocumentation:property-onPress-d: The callback when there is a press or click on the checkbox.
chipDocumentation:mainDescription: Chips help people enter information, make selections, filter content, or trigger actions. There are four types of chips: assist, filter, input, and suggestion.
chipDocumentation:property-elevated-desc: Whether the chip has an elevated style
chipDocumentation:property-leadingIcon-d: Icon to be displayed before (to left of) the chip content
chipDocumentation:property-trailingIcon-: Icon to be displayed after (to right of) the chip content
chipDocumentation:property-style-descrip: The styles for the chip component.
chipDocumentation:property-disabled-desc: If true, the component is disabled.
chipDocumentation:example1-description: Assist chip only has a leading icon and can be used only as an informative chip
chipDocumentation:example2-description: Filter chip has a leading icon and can be used as a selectable chip
chipDocumentation:example3-description: Filter chip has a leading icon and can be used as a selectable chip
chipDocumentation:example4-description: Input chip has both leading and trailing icon and can be used as a selectable chip
chipDocumentation:example5-description: Input chip has both leading and trailing icon and can be used as a selectable chip
chipDocumentation:example6-description: Suggestion chip has no icon and can be used as a selectable chip
chipDocumentation:example7-description: Suggestion chip has no icon and can be used as a selectable chip
containerDocumentation:mainDescription: Container helps you arrange your components clearly on the screen
containerDocumentation:property-flexDire: The direction in which the children components are positioned
containerDocumentation:property-align-de: The alignment of all items on the cross axis
containerDocumentation:property-justify-: The alignment of all items on the main axis.
containerDocumentation:property-style-de: The styles for the container component.
containerDocumentation:property-disableG: If true, the left and right padding is removed.
containerDocumentation:property-fixed-de: If true, sets the max-width to match the min-width of the current breakpoint.
containerDocumentation:property-width-de: The width of the container in pixels or percentage.
containerDocumentation:property-maxWidth: The maximum width of the container in breakpoints, pixels or percentage.
containerDocumentation:property-sx-descr: The system prop that allows defining system overrides as well as additional CSS styles.
radioDocumentation:mainDescription: Radio buttons allow users to select one option from a set.
radioDocumentation:property-id-descripti: Id of the radio button item.
radioDocumentation:property-selected-des: Id of the selected radio button.
radioDocumentation:property-label-descri: The label to display with the radio button.
radioDocumentation:property-labelPlaceme: Position where the label should be placed.
radioDocumentation:property-disabled-des: If true, the component is disabled.
radioDocumentation:property-color-descri: The color of the radio button component.
radioDocumentation:property-style-descri: The styles for the radio button component.
radioDocumentation:property-labelStyle-d: The styles for the label of the radio button.
radioDocumentation:property-containerSty: The styles for the container of the radio button.
radioDocumentation:property-onPress-desc: The callback when there is a press or click on the radio button.
typographyDocumentation:mainDescription: Typography is used to arrange the typefaces to create a visually appealing and effective communication design.
typographyDocumentation:example1-descrip: Displays are often used for large, attention-grabbing headlines or titles.
typographyDocumentation:example2-descrip: Headlines in graphic design are typically used for the main title or headline.
typographyDocumentation:example3-descrip: A title is used to label or describe a section, page, or component.
typographyDocumentation:example4-descrip: A body is used to display the main content or information.
typographyDocumentation:example5-descrip: A label is used to describe or provide additional information about a form field or any other user interface component.
typographyDocumentation:property-childre: Content that needs to be displayed
typographyDocumentation:property-size-de: The size of the typography component
typographyDocumentation:property-compone: The type of HTML component that needs to be rendered
typographyDocumentation:property-align-d: How to align the text of a typography component
typographyDocumentation:property-style-d: The styles for the typography component
typographyDocumentation:property-htmlFor: Only for Label. This can be used as "for" property in label component for web
textFieldDocumentation:mainDescription: Text fields allow users to enter text into a UI. They typically appear in forms and dialogs. There are two types of text fields: filled and outlined.
textFieldDocumentation:property-variant-: The type of the text field
textFieldDocumentation:property-label-de: The label for the text field
textFieldDocumentation:property-leadingI: Icon to be displayed to left of the text field
textFieldDocumentation:property-trailing: Icon to be displayed to right of the text field
textFieldDocumentation:property-disabled: If true, the component is disabled.
textFieldDocumentation:property-supporti: Support text need to be displayed with the text field.
textFieldDocumentation:property-errorMes: Error messages need to be displayed with the text field.
textFieldDocumentation:property-supporti: Styles for the supporting text of text field.
textFieldDocumentation:property-errorMes: Styles for the error messages of text field.
textFieldDocumentation:property-containe: Styles for container of the text field component.
textFieldDocumentation:property-textInpu: Styles for the text input of the text field component.
textFieldDocumentation:property-style-de: The styles for the text field component.
textFieldDocumentation:property-pressabl: The properties of the pressable component of react native (except sx)
textFieldDocumentation:property-sx-descr: The system prop that allows defining system overrides as well as additional CSS styles.
getting-started:mainDescription: To utilize Aṇu with your React Native or React Native web application, the following steps can be followed.
getting-started:step1:title: Install Aṇu
getting-started:step2:title: Transpile module
getting-started:step2:description: Add “anu” to the transpile packages in next.config.js file
getting-started:step3:title: Provider
getting-started:step4:title: For Next.js
getting-started:step4:description: These steps are only necessary if you are using Expo + Next.js. Otherwise, feel free to skip them.
getting-started:step4.1:title: 1. Add “anu” to the transpile packages in next.config.js file.
getting-started:step4.2:title: 2. Import the provider into _app.tsx file.
getting-started:step4.3:title: 3. Create a file in public/fonts directory called fonts.css and add the following code.
getting-started:step4.4:title: 4. Go to node_modules/react-native-vector-icons/Fonts and copy the MaterialIcons.ttf into your next/public/font directory.
getting-started:step4.5:title: 5. Now import font.css into _app.tsx file, on the top of all imports.
getting-started:step5:title: Icons
getting-started:step5:description: In case you require icons, you can install react-native-vector-icons.
credits:mainDescription: These packages have provided an essential foundation that enabled us to deliver high-quality results. Their work has saved us countless hours of development time and allowed us to deliver a superior product.
credits:packages:heading: Packages used
credits:packages:item-1: 1. <a class="documentation-link" target="blank" href="https://github.com/nandorojo/dripsy">nandorojo/dripsy<a/> - Responsive, unstyled UI primitives for React Native + Web
credits:packages:item-2: 2. gorhom/react-native-portal - A simplified portal implementation for React Native & Web.
credits:packages:item-3: 3. Flag icons created by Roundicons - Flaticon
theming:mainDescription: By following the provided steps, you can customize the appearance of the components in the library to align with the branding and design needs of your application. This can include the color scheme, typography, and other design elements that will be used throughout the application.
theming:step-1:title: Creating a theme
theming:step-1:description: Creating a new theme can be done with ease using the following approach. It involves extending the default theme provided by Anu, which results in a new theme object. This method draws inspiration from Dripsy and further guidance can be found in their documentation.
theming:step-2:title: Usage
theming:step-3:title: Color Modes
theming:step-3:description-1: The color modes available in the library are sourced from Material Design v3.
theming:step-3:description-2: Further information on this is provided in the following link: The Color System - Material Design 3.
theming:step-3:description-3: To obtain the color mode for your theme, you can utilize the material custom theme builder available at the following link: Material Theme Builder.
theming:step-4:title: Default Color Modes
theming:step-4:description: The theme can be utilized to customize these colors, and any modifications made will be consistently applied to all components within the library.
theming:step-5:title: Custom Fonts (In the future)
theming:step-5:description-1: The default font family in use is as follows: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, “Segoe UI”, Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif.
theming:step-5:description-2: By specifying a font family at the root level of the theme, it is possible to modify this setting globally throughout the library.
theming:step-6:title: Additional Links
theming:step-6:description-1: Material Theme Builder
theming:step-6:description-2: Styles - Material Design 3
